Comment: This is why. Singh, Bradley, & Zucker (2021) – A Follow-Up Study of Boys with Gender Identity Disorder •  Source: Frontiers in Psychology, 12, 2021 •  Study Design: Longitudinal follow-up of 139 boys diagnosed with gender identity disorder (GID, per DSM-IV) at a mean age of 7.49 years, reassessed at a mean age of 23.87 years (range: 13–30 years). Conducted at the Gender Identity Clinic in Toronto, Canada. •  Findings: 	•  Resolution Rate: 87.8% of participants no longer identified as transgender by adulthood, with 63.6% identifying as cisgender heterosexual and 24.2% as cisgender homosexual. Only 12.2% persisted with a transgender identity.

Huge agenda pusher for anti-trans ideology, he’s shown he’s happy to use biased techniques and problematic data again and again (Ashley 2018, Ansara and Hegarty 2012 2014).   Example: He’s been pushing for acceptance of Rapid Onset Gender Dysphoria for a long time. His work references the original study that led to the first discussion on RGOD. He has made comments that show he is aware of the critique of the recruitment for that study, but hand waves it and continues to lean on it (Schoenike, Coltan 2023).
